subject: RE: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: ... Until now, every time I had that many failures from just one problem, I actually had a design problem. Once I reasonable decoupled the design, I didn t get
messageBody:
> Cedric Beust wrote:

>> And as I was saying earlier, you are probably so used to JUnit that
>> when you read "101 FAILURES", you just *know* that it's not true that
>> 101 tests failed. You know that only one of them failed (maybe a
>> setUp or another test) and all the other ones are failing in cascade.

Until now, every time I had that many failures from just one problem, I
actually had a design problem. Once I reasonable decoupled the design, I
didn't get that many failures at once.

I might have been lucky, but I prefer to think of it as a skill.

Take care, Ilja
